Data:
==Applies To==

* iOS applications that use location services.

==What to Check For==

Verify that location data is not logged.

==Why==

Logging location data is likely to raise privacy concerns among users.

==How to Check==

To verify that location data is not logged:

# **Determine whether the application uses location services.**
# **Determine how location services are used.** Trace location data from source to sink and record each operation performed on it.
# **Verify that location data is not logged.** Examine the trace of location data from source to sink to make sure that location data is not being logged either on the device or on any remote server.

==How to Fix==

If your application uses location data, do not store it in files and do not send it to remote servers.

==Privacy Guidelines==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000001a0c7b|Do Not Cache Sensitive Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000930b93|Do Not Log Location Data]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000033f0db|Do Not Log Sensitive Data]]

==Privacy Checklists==
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000008cb7d6|Sensitive Data Is Not Cached]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-0000007e16f2|Location Data Is Not Logged]]
* [[00000000-0000-0000-0000-00000058bf53|Sensitive Data Is Not Logged]]
